SEARCH
Package com.simcraft.graphics.effects

Class TimedVisualEffect

java.lang.Object
com.simcraft.graphics.effects.TimedVisualEffect
All Implemented Interfaces:
VisualEffect
Direct Known Subclasses:
HitFlashEffect, ScreenDisintegrateEffect
public abstract class TimedVisualEffect extends Object implements VisualEffect
An abstract base class for time-based visual effects, providing common functionality such as tracking duration and completion. Subclasses of TimedVisualEffect will automatically handle the timing aspects of an effect.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    protected long
    durationMillis
    The total duration of the effect in milliseconds.
    protected boolean
    isEffectActive
    A flag indicating whether the effect is currently active and running.
    protected boolean
    isEffectFinished
    A flag indicating whether the effect has completed its duration.
    protected long
    startTime
    The time in milliseconds when the effect started.

    protected abstract void
    updateTimedEffect(long elapsedTime)
    Subclasses must implement this method to define how the visual effect changes over time, based on the elapsed time since the effect started.

  • Method Details

    • isEffectActive

      public boolean isEffectActive()
      Checks if the visual effect is currently active and running.
      Specified by:
      isEffectActive in interface VisualEffect
      Returns:
      true if the effect is active, false otherwise.

    • isEffectFinished

      public boolean isEffectFinished()
      Checks if the visual effect has completed its intended duration.
      Specified by:
      isEffectFinished in interface VisualEffect
      Returns:
      true if the effect has finished, false otherwise.

    • onStartEffect

      protected void onStartEffect()
      Hook method called when the visual effect starts. Subclasses can override this method to perform any setup or initialization required when the effect begins.

    • startEffect

      public void startEffect()
      Starts the visual effect, setting it to active and recording the start time. Subclasses should override the onStartEffect() method to implement any specific initialization logic.
      Specified by:
      startEffect in interface VisualEffect

    • updateEffect

      public void updateEffect()
      Updates the visual effect based on the elapsed time since it started. This method manages the effect's lifecycle based on its duration and calls the abstract updateTimedEffect(long) method for subclass-specific updates.
      Specified by:
      updateEffect in interface VisualEffect

    • onEffectEnd

      protected abstract void onEffectEnd()
      Hook method called when the visual effect ends (reaches its duration). Subclasses can override this method to perform any cleanup or final actions.

    • updateTimedEffect

      protected abstract void updateTimedEffect(long elapsedTime)
      Subclasses must implement this method to define how the visual effect changes over time, based on the elapsed time since the effect started.
      Parameters:
      elapsedTime - The time elapsed since the effect started in milliseconds.
